author: Jason La Canfora
title: Patriots prepared extra for Colts trickery, but not that specific play
text:
Not only were the New England Patriots not caught off-guard by the Colts attempting an onside kick and a fake punt (of sorts) last Sunday night, but the team spent additional time preparing for those very types of plays during their special-situation portions of practice, which are in general already longer and more in depth than many in the league.

The latest from SportsLine Week 7 NFL Picks 

When preparing for the Colts and Jaguars recently, the Patriots went to lengths to go over specific types of fakes and onside-kick alignments, fully expecting those two opponents to try to "steal" one or two possessions in their games, sources said. It was a point of emphasis across the special teams units for those two weeks with specific reviews of unusual formations to brace for.
While the Patriots did not study specifically for the bizarre fake-punt alignment deployed by the Colts, with just a two-man line involving neither a center nor a quarterback or running back, the team did quickly diagnose it was an illegal formation -- both players and coaches determined it -- and the sideline was yelling as much to those on the field. No Patriot flinched and the New England staff was shocked that the ball was actually snapped (resulting in an obvious loss of yards). The Patriots were prepared for trickery from Chuck Pagano in Week 6. (USATSI) Topics: Indianapolis Colts , New England Patriots , NFL About Jason La Canfora Follow on Twitter
